content:
Add a Range Input Element to a FlexCard

Available beginning Winter '22.

From the FlexCard Designer, click Inputs, and drag the Range element onto the canvas.
Configure properties:

* In Field Label, enter the label that appears next to the element.
* Check Read-only to disable the ability to modify the input values.
* In Help Text, enter helpful text about the purpose of the input field.
* Click into Default Value to select a default input value from a merge field.
* In Mask, provide an input mask that formats the range numbers.
* In Step, set by how much each number in the range increases.

To set the range of available numbers, enter a Minimum Value and Maximum Value.
Configure additional properties:

* Click + Add New in the Custom Attributes section to add custom attributes.
* Select from an attribute in the dropdown and enter a value for the attribute.
* To execute an action when a user interacts with the input element, click + Add Action.

Range Input Element Properties
Configurable in the Properties panel. Enable users to select from a range of numbers you specify.
SEE ALSO
FlexCards Input Elements Reference
title: Adding a Range Input Element to a FlexCard
